news_header: President Biden offers a historic apology to Native Americans in Arizona, addressing the injustices of federal policies and the traumatic legacy of boarding schools.
news_text: During his visit to Arizona, President Joe Biden apologized to the Gila River Indian Community for the injustices faced by Native peoples due to federal policies over the past 150 years. Accompanied by Interior Secretary Deb Haaland, Biden emphasized the importance of acknowledging the trauma inflicted by the boarding school system, which aimed to erase Tribal cultures. He called this era 'one of the darkest chapters of American history' and highlighted the need to 'right a wrong' while praising Native American culture. Biden's apology was framed as a step towards healing and strengthening relationships with Tribal Nations, while also addressing the political significance of his actions ahead of the upcoming presidential election.
